data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3152703,"name":"Josiah","username":"bakedPotatoLord","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bakedpotatolord/{size}/207771_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-25T20:49:39.167Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI’d like to have a roboRio run java code that can interface a node.js WebSocket server on a raspberry pi connected over ethernet. my node.js server is functional, but the java documentation that I’ve found for WebSocket communication is very vague, and I cant find any good examples. Additionally, I’m not even sure that it will work on roboRIO hardware. Could anyone point me to a good example of this, or perhaps let me know if I’m being stupid, and there’s a much better way for event-driven communication on the roboRIO.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-02-25T20:49:39.167Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":15,"reads":64,"readers_count":63,"score":87.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":428118,"topic_slug":"using-a-websocket-on-java-roborio","display_username":"Josiah","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51667,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Vice captain, software team lead."},"post_url":"/t/using-a-websocket-on-java-roborio/428118/1","custom_user_title":"Vice captain, software team lead.","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3152947,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-26T04:06:32.050Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI’m not very familiar with the Java implementation of WebSockets, but what most people use for coprocessor to Rio comm is NetworkTables, which can also be operated in an event driven way.  It also uses WebSockets, but in this case, the Rio is the server and other devices connect as clients.  If you wanted your node.js application to talk NT, you can–there’s at least one team-written TypeScript and one JavaScript client implementation that exist.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2023-02-26T04:06:32.050Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":54,"readers_count":53,"score":35.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":428118,"topic_slug":"using-a-websocket-on-java-roborio","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/using-a-websocket-on-java-roborio/428118/2","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3153464,"name":"Josiah","username":"bakedPotatoLord","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bakedpotatolord/{size}/207771_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-27T03:41:38.464Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThank you!
